verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:1
verses.text: The Twelve Patriarchs: I.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:2
verses.text: â€”The Testament of Reuben Concerning Thoughts.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:3
verses.text: The copy of the Testament of Reuben, what things he charged his sons before he died in the hundred and twenty-fifth year of his life.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:4
verses.text: When he was sick two years after the death of Joseph, his sons and his sons' sons were gathered together to visit him.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:5
verses.text: And he said to them, My children, I am dying, and go the way of my fathers.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:6
verses.text: And when he saw there Judah and Gad and Asher, his brethren, he said to them, Raise me up, my brethren, that I may tell to my brethren and to my children what things I have hidden in my heart, for from henceforth my strength faileth me.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:7
verses.text: And he arose and kissed them, and said, weeping:  Hear, my brethren, give ear to Reuben your father, what things I command you.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:8
verses.text: And, behold, I call to witness against you this day the God of heaven, that ye walk not in the ignorance of youth and fornication wherein I ran greedily, and I defiled the bed of Jacob my father.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:9
verses.text: For I tell you that He smote me with a sore plague in my loins for seven months; and had not Jacob our father prayed for me to the Lord, surely the Lord would have destroyed me.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:10
verses.text: For I was thirty years old when I did this evil in the sight of the Lord, and for seven months I was sick even unto death; and I repented for seven years in the set purpose of my soul before the Lord.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:11
verses.text: Wine and strong drink I drank not, and flesh entered not into my mouth, and I tasted not pleasant food, mourning over my sin, for it was great.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:12
verses.text: And it shall not so be done in Israel.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:13
verses.text: And now hear me, my children, what things I saw in my repentance concerning the seven spirits of error.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:14
verses.text: Seven spirits are given against man from Beliar, and they are chief of the works of youth; and seven spirits are given to him at his creation, that in them should be done every work of man.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:15
verses.text: The first  spirit is of life, with which man's whole being is created.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:16
verses.text: The second  spirit is of sight, with which ariseth desire.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:17
verses.text: The third  spirit is of hearing, with which cometh teaching.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:18
verses.text: The fourth  spirit is of smelling, with which taste is given to draw air and breath.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:19
verses.text: The fifth  spirit is of speech, with which cometh knowledge.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:20
verses.text: The sixth  spirit is of taste, with which cometh the eating of meats and drinks; and by them strength is produced, for in food is the foundation of strength.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:21
verses.text: The seventh  spirit is of begetting and sexual intercourse, with which through love of pleasure sin also entereth in:  wherefore it is the last in order of creation, and the first of youth, because it is filled with ignorance, which leadeth the young as a blind man to a pit, and as cattle to a precipice.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:22
verses.text: Besides all these, there is an eighth  spirit of sleep, with which is created entrancement of man's nature, and the image of death.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:23
verses.text: With these spirits are mingled the spirits of error.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:24
verses.text: The first , the spirit of fornication, dwelleth in the nature and in the senses; the second  spirit of insatiateness in the belly; the third  spirit of fighting in the liver and the gall.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:25
verses.text: The fourth  is the spirit of fawning and trickery, that through over-officiousness a man may be fair in seeming.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:26
verses.text: The fifth  is the spirit of arrogance, that a man may be stirred up and become high-minded.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:27
verses.text: The sixth  is the spirit of lying, in perdition and in jealousy to feign words, and to conceal words from kindred and friends.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:28
verses.text: The seventh  is the spirit of injustice, with which are theft and pilferings, that a man may work the desire of his heart; for injustice worketh together with the other spirits by means of craft.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:29
verses.text: Besides all these, the spirit of sleep, the eighth  spirit, is conjoined with error and fantasy.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:30
verses.text: And so perisheth every young man, darkening his mind from the truth, and not understanding the law of God, nor obeying the admonitions of his fathers, as befell me also in my youth.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:31
verses.text: And now, children, love the truth, and it shall preserve you.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:32
verses.text: I counsel you, hear ye Reuben your father.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:33
verses.text: Pay no heed to the sight of a woman, nor yet associate privately with a female under the authority of a husband, nor meddle with affairs of womankind.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:34
verses.text: For had I not seen Bilhah bathing in a covered place, I had not fallen into this great iniquity.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:35
verses.text: For my mind, dwelling on the woman's nakedness, suffered me not to sleep until I had done the abominable deed.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:36
verses.text: For while Jacob our father was absent with Isaac his father, when we were in Gader, near to Ephratha in Bethlehem, Bilhah was drunk, and lay asleep uncovered in her chamber; and when I went in and beheld her nakedness, I wrought that impiety, and leaving her sleeping I departed.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:37
verses.text: And forthwith an angel of God revealed to my father Jacob concerning my impiety, and he came and mourned over me, and touched her no more.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:38
verses.text: Pay no heed, therefore, to the beauty of women, and muse not upon their doings; but walk in singleness of heart in the fear of the Lord, and be labouring in works, and roaming in study and among your flocks, until the Lord give to you a wife whom He will, that ye suffer not as I did.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:39
verses.text: Until my father's death I had not boldness to look stedfastly into the face of Jacob, or to speak to any of my brethren, because of my reproach; and even until now my conscience afflicteth me by reason of my sin.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:40
verses.text: And my father comforted me; for he prayed for me unto the Lord, that the anger of the Lord might pass away from me, even as the Lord showed me.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:41
verses.text: From henceforth, then, I was protected, and I sinned not.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:42
verses.text: Therefore, my children, observe all things whatsoever I command you, and ye shall not sin.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:43
verses.text: For fornication is the destruction of the soul, separating it from God, and bringing it near to idols, because it deceiveth the mind and understanding, and bringeth down young men into hell before their time.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:44
verses.text: For many hath fornication destroyed; because, though a man be old or noble, it maketh him a reproach and a laughing-stock with Beliar and the sons of men.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:45
verses.text: For in that Joseph kept himself from every woman, and purged his thoughts from all fornication, he found favour before the Lord and men.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:46
verses.text: For the Egyptian woman did many things unto him, and called for magicians, and offered him love potions, and the purpose of his soul admitted no evil desire.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:47
verses.text: Therefore the God of my fathers delivered him from every visible and hidden death.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:48
verses.text: For if fornication overcome not the mind, neither shall Beliar overcome you.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:49
verses.text: Hurtful are women, my children; because, since they have no power or strength over the man, they act subtilly through outward guise how they may draw him to themselves; and whom they cannot overcome by strength, him they overcome by craft.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:50
verses.text: For moreover the angel of God told me concerning them, and taught me that women are overcome by the spirit of fornication more than men, and they devise in their heart against men; and by means of their adornment they deceive first their minds, and instil the poison by the glance of their eye, and then they take them captive by their doings, for a woman cannot overcome a man by force.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:51
verses.text: Therefore flee fornication, my children, and command your wives and your daughters that they adorn not their heads and their faces; because every woman who acteth deceitfully in these things hath been reserved to everlasting punishment.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:52
verses.text: For thus they allured the Watchers before the flood; and as these continually beheld them, they fell into desire each of the other, and they conceived the act in their mind, and changed themselves into the shape of men, and appeared to them in their congress with their husbands; and the women, having in their minds desire toward their apparitions, gave birth to giants, for the Watchers appeared to them as reaching even unto heaven.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:53
verses.text: Beware, therefore, of fornication; and if you wish to be pure in your mind, guard your senses against every woman.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:54
verses.text: And command them likewise not to company with men, that they also be pure in their mind.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:55
verses.text: For constant meetings, even though the ungodly deed be not wrought, are to them an irremediable disease, and to us an everlasting reproach of Beliar; for fornication hath neither understanding nor godliness in itself, and all jealousy dwelleth in the desire thereof.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:56
verses.text: Therefore ye will be jealous against the sons of Levi, and will seek to be exalted over them; but ye shall not be able, for God will work their avenging, and ye shall die by an evil death.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:57
verses.text: For to Levi the Lord gave the sovereignty, and to Judah, and to me also with them, and to Dan and Joseph, that we should be for rulers.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:58
verses.text: Therefore I command you to hearken to Levi, because he shall know the law of the Lord, and shall give ordinances for judgment and sacrifice for all Israel until the completion of the times of Christ, the High Priest whom the Lord hath declared.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:59
verses.text: I adjure you by the God of heaven to work truth each one with his neighbour; and draw ye near to Levi in humbleness of heart, that ye may receive a blessing from his mouth.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:60
verses.text: For he shall bless Israel; and specially Judah, because him hath the Lord chosen to rule over all the peoples.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:61
verses.text: And worship we his Seed, because He shall die for us in wars visible and invisible, and shall be among you an everlasting king.

verses.name: The Twelve Patriarchs: Reuben 1:62
verses.text: And Reuben died after that he had given command to his sons; and they placed him in a coffin until they bore him up from Egypt, and buried him in Hebron in the double cave where his fathers were.
